history.text: Hey there!
hi
what is the name of the movie?
Batman Begins!
The start of the Christopher Nolan Batman trilogy
oh, is that the one with Anne Hathaway?
No that was the third of the trilogy I believe
This was with Katie Holmes
Liam Neeson was prominent throughout as his teacher

oh, I just saw an interview today with her - on Jimmy Fallon or Jimmy Kimmel, can't remember. She fixed her teeth finally.  /What's the most interesting thing you were told about the movie in the document?
Well it’s metacritic score was a 70/100, seems low
have you seen this movie, would you recommend watching it?
And I never knew Alfred’s last name was Pennyworth
were you told the year the movie came out?
Yes I’ve seen it multiple times, I am a big fan of Bale as Batman and Nolan directing
It came out in 2005
that's the year after I graduated uni, lol. / were you told how long the movie is?
I don’t see how long, my guess is around two hours. Have you seen it?
no, I'm not into Batman movies... Were you told whether the movie got any awards (for directing, cinematography, acting) - this could affect my decision...
(That was the year I graduated high school)
I see... So what about the movie's awards? Any info?
No only that it was  a 7.7/10 on rotten tomatoes and an A for CinemaScore
Are you a fan of Nolan?
that's quite a good score... I remember Stephanie Zackarek, a film critic I usually agree with, is usually harsh about such big movies. Were you told what was her opinion about the movie?
No she is not listed directly. Nolan directed movies such as Interstellar, Inception and most recently Dunkirk
no, to be honest I don't care about Nolan. and I don't usually like big movies. the one with Daniel Craig and that French actress is probably the only big movie I liked in the last years.
I meant James Bond' movie with Daniel Craig... Does the movie you were told about has any other female actresses listed than Katie Holmes?
_other than_ Katie Holmes I mean
ah I see. Yeah this was a lot more creative, less big picture style Batman. Katie Holmes is the only female mentioned. As I mentioned Liam Neeson is in it, Gary Oldman and Michael Caine as well.

(we need at least 15 exchanges to get paid, the time limit for the chat is 15min if I remember correctly, very little time is left, could you please reply faster?) oh, Michael Caine I like. That Italian movie with him and Harvey Keitel and Rachel Weisz was fun
It’s about the origin and early times of Batman. Essentially his development from regular guy to the hero
so is there a "young Batman" character in this movie? (a teenage actor, I mean) who is playing him?
Caine usually has the slight jabs of comedy in the Batman movies
No not teenage, but there is a small youth part but he’s not Batman, just young Bruce Wayne
More like his journey and travels for the few years before he returns to Gotham City and develops Batman
He’s sick of the crime that has taken over the city and how cops can’t or won’t do anything about it
are you told what are the special powers of the costume?
the Batman' costume/armor I mean
No that’s not discussed, I only have specific scenes being added now

"He’s sick of the crime that has taken over the city and how cops can’t or won’t do anything about it" - isn't it his attitude in every Batman movie? :) (I remember seeing one of the old ones on TV when I was a teenager)
Yeah it’s a pretty generic atatement from me
what "specific scenes"? any funny ones?
No the first one is where he’s a child and how he develops his phobia of bats
and how he develops this phobia?
Yes, that ultimately leads to it fueling him
any info about his mother? what was she like? or at least the father?
His mother and father were killed by a thief around that same age
His father was the entrepreneur and philanthropist but still was gunned down in the streets. This was a huge development in the direction of Bruce’s life obviously

this sounds familiar, I probably saw something about this in that old Batman movie on TV - I vaguely remember now, it seems it was directed by this English weird fairy tale style movie director, who made Edward Scissorhands..
yeah, childhood trauma.
Yes that was an earlier adaption in 1990 by Tim Burton
yes!
Who like you said did Ed Scisscors
yeah
which movie is better, the one you are told about or that one, in case you've seen them both?
That one was a little odd. Better writing, acting, character development this time around
the old one was very interesting visually - that I remember. had never seen anything like that
You don’t have to be a superhero junkie to like the Nolan Batman movies, his are a little darker then Hollywood superhero movies
what do you mean by better writing this time around. sharper dialogues?
better one-liners?
Very much so, less of the comic book style dialogue
I think it’s definitely worth a watch for anyone, you don’t need to be a superhero fan
and what did you mean by better acting this time? could it be that you just like the actors in this movie better than the ones in the old movie?
You could be right, Christian Bale is better than Michael Keaton and George Clooney batman portrayals
(I noticed being biased myself about such stuff - especially if the actors are in the same age group as I am, and look similar to me)
But other co stars from the older ones were also top notch
oh, George Clooney's Batman is a famously bad one
who are the older ones, other than Caine and Neeson?
From the old movies, famously Jack Nicholson was the joker
Before Nolan’s second Batman movie he did that starred Heath Ledger in the role
that one I saw, I'm asking about older ones in the movie you were told about
Oh that’s what I meant by older, the early 90s
("that one I saw" - that was me about the one with Jack Nicholson.)
oh, I see. but you weren't told who is else in the movie, other than Katie Holmes, Caine, Neeson?
Right, early 90s for me is older. This was the first of three Nolan ones, starting in 2005
Gary Oldman
And obviously Bale
So what do you think? Is this a movie you might give a look?
Are you still there?

probably, because i've just spent so much time thinking about it and talking about it. this alone made em curious :) also, I'm curious to see a Nolan movie with "fresh eyes" - I dislike him from my years of reading books on film directing (was entertaining idea about going into it), maybe now I'm more of a simpletone / normal movie watcher and might like him... also, I realized I'm biased because of his looks. I remember him looking like the perosn I wouldn't like in real life.
Oh lol sorry
so I want to check out how the current version of me will react to the whole thing.
ok, so I've made my decision, we can stop now it seems
thats interesting I also looked into film directing and read several books but I guess I never took on that view of Nolan.
Yup, hopefully you enjoy!
The Visual Story - filmmaking book - was so great!

uid1response.feedback: I am not sure if the user was British or possibly Canadian but they had not seen the movie and really weren’t a fan of the director. They asked for information I did not have, this conversation wasn’t the smoothest but I think they’re going to use some fresh eyes and watch it now.

uid2response.feedback: I was forced to think about it, talk about it for so long that I got curious about the movie. Also, it has Michael Caine at least - I like him. Also, I haven't seen a Nolan movie in a very long time - I'm curious how the current version of me will react to his movie, how my visual & entertainment preferences have changed.
